metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5129 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google V8 before 5.2.361.32, as used in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.82, does not properly process left-trimmed objects, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
